text: hey everybody sam here from Sugar's fun
run and today I'll be showing you how to
make a pumpkin cheesecake we are going
to be making this cheesecake completely
from scratch and there is no water bath
required you'll want to pre-heat your
oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit and we
will start by making our graham cracker
crust
you will need seven tablespoons of
melted butter and we'll add one and a
half cups of crushed graham cracker
crumbs add two tablespoons of granulated
sugar and one tablespoon of brown sugar
and use a spoon to stir that together
until combined we will be making our
cheesecake in a nine or ten inch
springform pan and so we'll pour our
graham cracker crust crumbs initiative
pan and then we'll just smooth out these
crumbs to make our crust I always use a
clean measuring cup to tamp down those
crumbs for a nice stable graham cracker
crust you'll want to push the crumbs up
the side just a little bit to make that
crust with this crust prepped we're
going to place it in our fridge while we
make our pumpkin cheesecake batter now
we will prepare our pumpkin cheesecake
batter I like to use my stand mixer for
this recipe but you can use an electric
hand mixer instead we are going to add
24 ounces or 3/8 ounce bricks of cream
cheese into the bowl of our stand mixer
work that in there and I like to let my
cream cheese softened for about an hour
before I begin baking in fact with any
cheesecake all of your ingredients
should really be at room temperature
before you begin so I definitely
recommend setting everything out before
you get started
now we'll add 3/4 cup of tightly packed
light brown sugar and 1/2 cup of
granulated sugar will turn our mixer to
low speed and stir until the cream
cheese and sugar are well combined and
if you're using a stand mixer you're
probably going to need to pause
periodically and scrape the sides and
bottom of your bowl just to make sure
that everything gets well combined with
our cream cheese and our sugars of well
combined we can now add our sour cream
this recipe uses one
a cup of sour cream we'll also add one
and a half teaspoons of vanilla extract
at this point now comes the pumpkin for
today's recipe you are going to want to
use pure pumpkin puree do not grab a
canned stuff that says pumpkin pie
filling on it so we are going to add one
cup of pumpkin puree and we will also
add two and a half teaspoons of pumpkin
pie spice
now we'll stir these together until
they're well combined and I'm just going
to use my spatula again to scrape the
sides and bottom because I want all of
these ingredients to be really well
combined my pumpkin cheesecake recipe
calls for three large eggs but you do
not want to add these all at once we are
going to add our eggs one at a time
stirring after each addition until the
eggs have been just combined because we
do not want to over mix this batter
earth can cause your cheesecake to have
cracks now that my eggs have been just
combined into the batter I'm going to
take my spatula one more time and give
everything a nice stir so that I know
the eggs are well combined without being
over beaten by using my mixer alright
this batter is looking pretty good so
now I'm going to grab my graham cracker
crust and we'll pour our pumpkin
cheesecake batter into our springform
pan I'll just use my spatula to smooth
out the top our pumpkin cheesecake is
now ready to bake we are going to
transfer this to our 350 degrees
fahrenheit oven and bake for about 40 to
45 minutes what you're looking for is
the edges to just be beginning to turn
lightly golden brown and if you touch
the center of the cheesecake it should
wiggle slightly but bounce back to the
touch once our cheesecake has finished
baking we are going to want to let this
cool completely to room temperature then
once it's cooled you'll transfer it to
your refrigerator and let it chill for
at least another four to six hours
preferably overnight to allow it to set
completely once your pumpkin cheesecake
is filled you can certainly serve it as
is but I like to top mine with a simple
homemade cinnamon whipped cream to make
this whipped cream you'll want to
combine 3/4 cup of heavy cream
make sure that's cold
1/4 cup of powdered sugar 1/2 teaspoon
of vanilla extract and just 1/8 teaspoon
of ground cinnamon use an electric mixer
to beat the ingredients together until
they're combined and then gradually
increase your mixer speed to high and
beat until stiff peaks form now you can
just dollop your whipped cream right on
top of your pumpkin cheesecake if you'd
like but I'm going to pipe mine on I'm
using a Wilton 2d tip and a piping bag
let's release our pumpkin cheesecake
from its springform pan before we cover
it with whipped cream and now I'll top
my pumpkin cheesecake with my whipped
cream all right let's dig in and that is
how you make pumpkin cheesecake from
scratch let's go ahead and dig in oh
look at that texture guys this
cheesecake is so good I really hope you
will try it out and if you do please let
me know what you think of it thank you
so much for watching and I will see you
next time
